data.title: Ep 16: Creative Conversations with Karina Korol by Missed Opportunities for Good
data.meta_description:
Today we’re joined by Karina Korol, an independent creative director and designer, who is focused on ‘climate creativism’. Join us to learn about her love of working with scientists, making beautiful work, and how she’s using her creativity to tackle the looming crisis of our time. She brought us LG’s “Better Choices Make a Better World” campaign to evaluate live using our criteria. 
Follow Karina on LinkedIn.

This week we’re discussing June celebrations, Pride and Juneteenth, along with a call for community activism.

The first case study is Grindr, who is celebrating their 15 year anniversary with the Grinds Rides America bus tour, bringing fun and healthcare by Q Care Plus to pride celebrations in 10 cities across the US. Also check out the work they’re doing with G4E.

Next up we cover this year’s Skittles Pride campaign in partnership with Meetup, building community and raising money for GLAAD.

Ben & Jerry’s is back in action with “Progress Comes in Many Flavors” with a call to the community to step up and Make Some Motherchunkin Change.

We wrap up with CHATJuneteenth, a new innovative app from BarkleyOKRP and Putney that should be your new go to for education on all things related to Juneteenth.

This week we audit 3 marketing campaigns and their impact on social change, plus a quick overview of a variety of campaigns for Pride.

The first case study focuses on the LEGO Play Unstoppable l Play Moves Us⁠ which celebrates the endless potential of girls when they are given the opportunity and support to be confident, expressive, bold, courageous, supportive and truly play. We discuss LEGO’s evolution to make their products more gender inclusive, value in positive messaging that shifts cultural beliefs for good, and opportunities to continue to amplify their impact.

Next up is ⁠Mastercard & Stand Up 2 Cancer: Together We’re Bigger. This campaign encourages consumers to come together to support cancer research through everyday dining and grocery purchases. For this campaign, we highlight elements they’re doing well & provide suggestions for missed opportunities for good to increase their impact even more.

Final case study is ⁠North Face Summer of Pride⁠ with ⁠Pattie Gonia and encouraging the LGBTQ+ community to get outside & welcoming them to the outdoors with open arms. We touch on what North Face has done differently in terms of standing by the LGBTQ+ community, and highlight additional brands who are supporting Pride month in a meaningful way.

This week we audit three marketing campaigns and their impact on social change.

The first case study focuses on Dove's "Cost of Beauty + Self Esteem Project," which highlights the cost of beauty and self-esteem, and advocates to sign a petition to pass the Kids Online Safety Act. Spoiler alert: Dove does an excellent job.

Next up is Samsung's Voices of Galaxy campaign, which highlights real people making positive impacts through unusual uses of their phones. For this campaign, we provide solutions for a number of the missed opportunities for good.

Final case study is P&G's "Unbecoming: My Black is Beautiful" celebrating natural hair and redefining beauty standards for Black women. We highlight the campaign's success in inclusivity, and representation, as well as offer an additional suggestion to achieve maximum impact.

Welcome to Missed Opportunities for Good. The podcast where we open up the space to have conversations about trends we’re seeing at the intersection of marketing + impact.

Hosted by Steph Belsky, Co-Founder + Madame President of Love of Good, and Alana Ficalora, Founder of Aligned for Impact. Our goal is to provide you with a roadmap to effectively and strategically incorporate impact as part of your marketing and advertising campaigns, and maybe think a little differently about the impact of your messaging.

Each month we’ll showcase 3 impact driven campaigns, and evaluate based on our proprietary criteria. We will also have conversations with creatives who are taking action and incorporating these values in all facets of their life.

Let’s shine a light and learn from those who are doing it well and reduce the missed opportunities for good. Join us on our mission to revolutionize the industry that we love.

Powered by ⁠Love of Good + Aligned for Impact⁠
